availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Hiram G. Pratt (Perry County, Kentucky, farmer, justice of the peace, and soldier.)

body.p: Perry County, Kentucky, farmer, justice of the peace, and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Henry Pratt and Sallie Gibson Pratt. Married to Rhoda Campbell Pratt. Father of Henry Pratt, William Pratt, Betty Pratt, Sally Pratt, Patsy Pratt, John Pratt, Joel Pratt, Stephen Pratt, and Hiram Pratt. Farmer in Perry County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Perry County in 1860. Justice of the peace in Perry County in 1860. Served in the 13th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (C.S.A.) as a second lieutenant from September 9, 1862, to February 16, 1865.

ab.bibl:

Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994045, Letcher County Births.

KYR-0001-025-0017.
